oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tennessee Farmer masthead and Tennesse silk
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Agriculture
Agriculture; Periodicals; Horticulture; Silk industry; Sericulture
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Front page of the "Tennessee Farmer" issue for January, 1837, contains the article entitled "Tennessee Silk."
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Emmerson, Thomas, 1773-1837, Deaderick, J.F.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Though a nursery would be established in 1838 to raise morus morticaulis seedlings, silk manufacturing companies would arise, the Tennessee Silk Society would form in 1840, and the Tennessee Silk Manufacturing Company and Agricultural School would open in Port Royal in 1842 to train silk workers, the investment of Tennessee farmerswould be lost with an epidemic in the 1850s that destroyed the silk worms and the industry.
